snippet: Measuring it once is a relatively simple task. Measure it again and again, and you might find yourself on a roller-coaster ride.
abstract: Gina Kolata essay examines difficulty of determining one's true blood pressure or whether one has hypertension when number seems to change depending on several factors; notes frequent readings under ideal conditions provide most accuracy, while several readings falling within normal range may indicate there is no cause for concern.
lead_paragraph: Measuring it once is a relatively simple task. Measure it again and again, and you might find yourself on a roller-coaster ride.

headline.print_headline: 2 Numbers to Make Your Head Swim
headline.main: Blood Pressure, a Reading With a Habit of Straying
